decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly building up your own resources. Atraxa, Grand Unifier serves as a powerful commander that can provide additional value with proliferate, allowing you to put more counters on your own permanents or weaken your opponent's. The deck includes a variety of versatile spells like Force of Will, Demonic Tutor, and Supreme Verdict to handle different threats and situations. By efficiently managing your resources and making key decisions, you can outmaneuver your opponent and eventually secure victory through overwhelming control of the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and disruptive creatures. Glarb, Calamity's Augur, as the commander, provides a powerful tool for generating card advantage and manipulating the opponent's resources. The deck includes a wide range of interaction spells like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also features card selection and filtering with Brainstorm, Preordain, and Consider to find key pieces of the puzzle. By efficiently answering threats and leveraging card advantage, this control deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a dominant position on the battlefield, ultimately grinding out a win through attrition and strategic plays.

The deck revolves around assembling a fast and aggressive board presence using Marath, Will of the Wild as the commander. The key strategy is to use efficient creatures and ramp spells to quickly generate mana, while also utilizing cards like Birthing Pod and Eldritch Evolution to tutor for key pieces. The deck also includes hate cards like Magus of the Moon and Grand Abolisher to disrupt opponents' strategies. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and powerful enchantments like Earthcraft. The deck aims to win by establishing a dominant board presence and pushing for lethal damage quickly.

This deck is focused on aggressive gameplay using Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as the commander. The deck includes a mix of disruptive cards like Containment Priest and Drannith Magistrate to control the board while deploying threats like Blade Splicer and Palace Jailer to apply pressure. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Swords to Plowshares to deal with opposing threats. With a mix of creatures and disruptive elements, the deck aims to establish an early aggressive board presence and maintain control over the game. It utilizes cards like Stoneforge Mystic and equipments like Skullclamp to generate card advantage and push through damage efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of land ramp and land destruction, utilizing Azusa, Lost But Seeking as the commander. The deck includes cards that allow for quick land drops such as Exploration, Burgeoning, and Courser of Kruphix. It also includes powerful land destruction cards like Dust Bowl, Tectonic Edge, and Oblivion Stone to disrupt opponents' mana base. Additionally, there are cards like Primeval Titan and Realms Uncharted to search for key lands like Dark Depths or Maze of Ith. The deck aims to establish a strong land base while preventing opponents from doing the same, ultimately controlling the game and winning through powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End or Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

The deck revolves around using a variety of control spells, counterspells, and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while protecting your own key threats. Ertai Resurrected serves as both a powerful control piece and a win condition, allowing you to counter or remove threats while slowly building up your own board presence. The deck also focuses on card advantage and manipulation, with cards like Brainstorm, Intuition, and Vedalken Shackles helping you stay ahead in the game. By combining efficient removal, powerful countermagic, and resilient threats, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually take over the game through sheer card advantage and control of the board.

The deck focuses on utilizing a wide range of low-cost creatures, artifacts, and enchantments to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Birds of Paradise, Elvish Mystic, and Arbor Elf for mana acceleration, along with efficient creatures like Rograkh, Son of Rohgahh and Party Thrasher, the deck aims to establish a fast clock and pressure the opponent early in the game. Additionally, cards like Earthcraft, Green Sun's Zenith, and Song of Creation provide further utility and card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain its aggression and resilience throughout the match. The key strategy revolves around setting up a fast and overwhelming board presence to secure a quick victory.
